data.event: As of the 2010 United States Census, Harrison's population was 13,620, reflecting a decline of 804 (-5.6%) from the 14,424 counted in the 2000 Census, which had in turn increased by 999 (+7.4%) from the 13,425 counted in the 1990 Census.

data.event: The area that is now Harrison was a part of a charter granted to Captain William Sandford of Barbados.

event.title: 1755, the first steam engine in North America was set up

data.event: In 1755, the first steam engine in North America was set up at the Schuyler Copper Mine in what is now North Arlington to help drain water from the mine.
